source_text.text:
﻿Kay Kavus is captured in Mazandaran, so Rostam rides out to rescue him. In the first trials he fights a lion, endures thirst in the desert, and hunts for food. He prays, and divine aid guides him onward.
Rostam defeats a dragon in the dark and resists the enchantress who tries to kill him. He also survives poisoned feasts meant to sap his strength. Each labor pairs his brute force with vigilance and faith.
In the final trials he overpowers the demon champions, including the White Demon. Rostam blinds the White Demon and uses its blood to restore the sight of Kay Kavus and his men. The seven labors prove his role as Iran’s protector.

bias_reflection.cultural_reading: Labors read as divine tests proving heroic legitimacy.
bias_reflection.gender_norms: Male-coded hero; helpers include animal steed and occasional guides.
bias_reflection.hero_villain_mapping: Monsters and demons as chaos; Rostam as restorer of order.
ambiguous_motifs: Donor vs helper in sorceress episode
